result.execSummary:
The defendant David Burnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court grants the defendant huber, and the sentence may be served in another county, if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County.  On July 21, 2015 the Court amended the JOC to reflect No Huber.

1.  AODA and any follow-up.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

ADDRESS INFO for David Burnett
Current: 1016 Cameron Ave, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: 704 Division St, La Crosse, WI 54601-4608 United States

3:19 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

25 days county jail with huber and out of county service
court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
AODA

Court grants the defendant 90 days to start servin the sentence.

Court adjourned at 3:27 p.m.
Sentencing hearing at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm

2:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge, with no park enhancer.  Atty Privat concurs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the park enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.

Court sets for sentencing on May 11, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:46 p.m.

Current: 902 Caledonia St, La Crosse, WI 54603 United States  (Effective: 12-03-2014)

1:14 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - offer has been made - needs additional time.  

Court directs case be set for Plea/Sentencing and to be held in approximately thirty days.  If not Plea/Sentencing, Court will set for trial.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on November 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Discovery Demand
for Discovery (Defendant's)

1:17 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat indicates the defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs case be set for Status Hearing to be scheduled with Attorney Privat.  Statement by DA regarding letter from the defendant regarding forfeiture of some currency.  DA requests that case be set for hearing and held prior to November 29th.  Clerk states the case (civil) is scheduled for a TSCN on October 22nd.  DA states hearing must be held within sixty days.

Court adjourned at 1:20 p.m.
Status of Prelim on October 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
By Atty Barbara Privat
Status hearing on October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status of Counsel in approx 2-3 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:49 a.m.
